summary: This document is an FBI operational travel plan detailing the deployment of personnel to St. Thomas, U.S. Virgin Islands, to execute a search warrant on 'Epstein Island' (Little St. James). It outlines the schedule from August 8-14, 2019, listing the roles and travel dates for agents, the Evidence Response Team (ERT), and support staff.

persons.name: TFO
persons.context: Multiple Task Force Officers (TFO) are listed as part of the Case Squad traveling to St. Thomas to assist with the search warrant execution.

persons.name: SSA
persons.context: A Supervisory Special Agent (SSA) from Crisis Management is scheduled to travel to St. Thomas on August 9 to join the advance team for planning.

persons.name: ASAC
persons.role: FBI Assistant Special Agent in Charge
persons.context: An Assistant Special Agent in Charge (ASAC) is listed as a passenger traveling to St. Thomas on August 11.

persons.name: ITS.1MM
persons.context: An individual with the identifier ITS.1MM is listed as the sole member of the Computer Analysis Response Team (CART) traveling on August 11 for technical support.

persons.name: Swill
persons.context: An individual named Swill is scheduled to fly to St. Thomas on August 12 to join the search team and provide DExT (Digital Evidence Extraction Team) support.

persons.name: SOS
persons.context: A Special Agent (SA) with the identifier SOS is listed as part of the Case Squad traveling on August 11.

connections.description: Multiple Special Agents and Task Force Officers are listed together as members of the same Case Squad traveling to execute the search warrant.
The Supervisory Special Agent (SSA) from Crisis Management is traveling to assist the advance team, which includes other Special Agents (SA).
The Assistant Special Agent in Charge (ASAC) and a Lieutenant (Lt) are listed as passengers on the same flight to St. Thomas, indicating coordinated travel for the operation.
Special Agents and the CART specialist (ITS.1MM) are part of the same operational team deployed to St. Thomas, with ITS.1MM providing technical support.

events.title: Advance Planning Travel
events.description: An FBI Special Agent (RDT POC SA) travels to St. Thomas for advance planning related to the Rapid Deployment Team (RDT) and Evidence Response Team (ERT).

events.title: Warrant Swearing and Interviews
events.description: Case agents, a Special Agent (SA), and a Task Force Officer (TFO) travel to St. Thomas to swear out a search warrant and conduct select employee interviews for intelligence prior to the search.

events.title: Crisis Management Arrival
events.description: A Supervisory Special Agent (SSA) and a Special Agent (SA) from Crisis Management travel to St. Thomas to join the advance team and assist with RDT/ERT preparation.

events.title: Main Team Deployment
events.description: 38 personnel, including an ASAC, Lieutenant, 16 ERT members, 18 Case Squad members, and 1 CART specialist, travel to St. Thomas on an FBI aircraft.

events.title: Search Warrant Execution
events.description: The FBI team executes the search warrant on 'Epstein Island'. An individual named Swill flies in to join the team and provide DExT support.

events.title: Search Continues
events.description: The search of the property continues.

events.title: Search Conclusion and Departure
events.description: The search is anticipated to be wrapped up, and the entire team is scheduled to depart.

keyFacts: The FBI planned a large-scale, multi-day search operation on 'Epstein Island' (Little St. James) in August 2019.
The operation involved 38 personnel, including Evidence Response Teams, Case Squads, Crisis Management, and technical support (CART/DExT).
The plan details a phased approach: advance planning (Aug 8-9), main team deployment (Aug 11), warrant execution (Aug 12), and search continuation/conclusion (Aug 13-14).
The document is a logistical plan, indicating a high level of coordination and preparation by federal law enforcement.
The search was executed shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's arrest on July 6, 2019, and his death in custody on August 10, 2019, placing this operation in the immediate aftermath of those events.
